name: James Reese Europe
description: '''James Reese Europe''' (February 22, 1880 â€“ May 9, 1919) was an American [[ragtime]] and early [[jazz]] [[bandleader]], [[arranger]], and [[composer]]. He was the leading figure on the [[African Americans|African-American]] music scene of New York City in the 1910s. [[Eubie Blake]] called him the "[[Martin Luther King]] of music".
